meanings.definition: Speak in a slow, lazy, elongated manner.
meanings.sent1: She was drawling her words as if she had all the time in the world.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy drawled out his instructions to the new ranch hand.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat started drawling a story about chasing mice in its dreams.
meanings.sent4: His drawling voice wrapped around her like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The drawling sound of the old record player filled the room with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: Produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks on paper or another surface.
meanings.sent1: She drawled a simple flower on the corner of her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The artist drawled a beautiful landscape with just a pencil and paper.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child drawled a stick figure of the teacher on the chalkboard.
meanings.sent4: His pen drawled a masterpiece that captured the essence of the city.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's spray can drawled colorful shapes on the brick wall.
